meanings.sent1: She enjoys inweaving different colored threads to create beautiful patterns.
meanings.sent2: The spider was inweaving its web in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The chef skillfully inwove the flavors together to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The dancers inweaved their movements with grace and precision.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush inweaved vibrant colors onto the canvas, bringing the painting to life.

meanings.definition: To incorporate or blend into something else
meanings.sent1: He tried inweaving his ideas into the group discussion.
meanings.sent2: The architect inwove modern elements into the traditional design.
meanings.sent3: The comedian humorously inwove audience suggestions into his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: Her voice inweaved a sense of calm into the chaotic situation.
meanings.sent5: The author skillfully inwove historical events into the fictional narrative, creating a rich tapestry of storytelling.
